This app demonstrates several key aspects of `input_dark_mode()`:

1. Basic Usage
   - Simple dark mode toggle with default behavior
   - Dark mode input with initial mode set to "dark"
   - Customized dark mode input with additional styling

2. Reactive Behaviors
   - Displays the current state of different dark mode inputs
   - Dynamically changes content based on the dark mode state
   - Provides manual mode switching buttons

3. Additional Features
   - Uses Font Awesome for potential icon styling
   - Demonstrates reactive effects and mode updates
   - Shows how dark mode can affect UI content

Key Points:
- Uses Shiny Express syntax
- No external data files
- Comprehensive demonstration of `input_dark_mode()` parameters
- Reactive and interactive design

When you run this app, you'll be able to:
- Toggle dark mode using different inputs
- See how the mode changes affect the UI
- Manually force light or dark mode
- Observe the current mode states

The app showcases the flexibility of the dark mode input in Shiny for Python, demonstrating how it can be used to create adaptive, user-friendly interfaces.
